meanings.definition: Having more leaves than something else.
meanings.sent1: The jungle is much leafier than the desert.
meanings.sent2: The tree in our backyard is getting leafier as spring approaches.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would see a leafier plant than the one in our garden!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a leafier forest, full of thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The forest became even leafier after the rain, with each tree covered in fresh green leaves.

meanings.sent1: This salad is leafier than the one I had yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The garden looks leafier now that we added more plants.
meanings.sent3: I feel like a leafier version of myself after eating all these greens!
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a leafier shade of green than the grass.
meanings.sent5: The painting became even leafier after the artist added more foliage details.
